result.execSummary:
The defendant Renee L Russell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Can be transferred to Jefferson County.

miscConds.notes:
Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 05-01-2015 and/or 52 hours of Community Service to be completed by completion of Probation.  Court must receive notice of completion by 01-22-2017.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
No contact with medical professionals without approval of Probation Agent unless in an emergency.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  30 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED and to be used at the Agent's discretion.  Can be served in Jefferson County.
Each year of Probation with last 20 hours to be completed by November, 2017.

Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.

Defendant Renee L Russell in court with attorney Reisha Mitchell.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Harnisch from the City of Oconomowoc was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. State presents exhibit #1 marked. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
